result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle L Steward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence; credit for 180 days served.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No further violations of the law.
No contact with victim except as approved by Children's Court.

Complete Batterer's Intervention program geared towards victims of domestic violence.
Court recommends treatment with META house.
Attend parenting classes.
Follow all orders of children's court and the Milwaukee Bureau of Child Welfare.
Mental Health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she must provide a DNA sample if not already given, pay the surcharge, her voting rights are suspended.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle L Steward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant explaining why he did not receive credit.
Letter from defendant questioning why he did not receive credit.
Original Transcript (19 pages) commencing 07/28/2014 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

signed and filed.  Copies sent to parties.  rmm

The petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Rebecca Dallet, Br. 40, for review. mag

Defendant Danielle L Steward in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Danielle L Steward in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 49 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 180 days served.  Court ordered 13 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 36 MONTHS Extended Supervision.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program geared towards victims of domestic violence.
- Court recommends treatment with META house.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Follow all orders of children's court and the MIlwaukee Bureau of Child Welfare.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim except as approved by Children's Court.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample if not already given, pay the surcharge, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.

Defendant Danielle L Steward in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Danielle L Steward in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 40.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.   Court grants substitution.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

to Modify the No Contact Order signed and filed.  IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the Written Contact be modified to allow for Personal Nonviolent Contact.  All other conditions of the defendant's bond shall remain if full force and effect.  rmm
to Modify the No Contact Order received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm
At the request of the defense, Court modified the no contact order to allow for WRITTEN contact with TS.

Defendant Danielle L Steward in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  The 5/27/14 jury trial is vacated.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Danielle L Steward in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Danielle L Steward in custody.  Matthew Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case set for Final Pretrial.  State has made a new offer to the defense and parties would like a new final pretrial date.    Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.   rmm
State's Notice of Intent to Introduce Videotaped Statements of Witnesses Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 908.08 received and filed.   rmm
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Danielle L Steward not in court, in custody.  Cynthia Davis for Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Danielle L Steward in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Danielle L Steward in custody.  
Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Br. 4 for Br. 40.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Packet of discovery turnd over to defense counsel from the State.  

Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.

Court ordered case adjourned for Bail / Bond Hearing and Scheduling Conference in Branch 40 on 2-21-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TS dob 4/26/05 unless that contact is approved by the orders of the Milwaukee County Children's Court Judge via the parallel CHIPS action

Defendant Danielle L Steward in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Danielle L Steward in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary Hearing to be heard by Judge Flanagan for Judge Dallet.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
